data.title: Secrets and Easter Eggs in Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
data.meta_description: The following is a list of secrets, easter eggs, and hidden trivia references in Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas.
data.text:
Image Description Beta Location

Inside on one of the guard booths (the one that is near the spawn location of Leviathan and Raindance) in the Easter Bay Airport, there is a computer running a map editor, possibly showing a beta location from the game. Catalina's Past

Near Catalina's cabin, there are three graves and a shovel, suggesting she may have murdered and buried past lovers prior to meeting Carl Johnson. Gant Bridge Facts

In the visitor center below Katie Zhan's House, there is a list of facts about the Gant Bridge, one of which reads "It takes up a staggering 1.27mb!"

In the Definitive Edition, the sign is updated to reflect the size of the new version of the bridge, reading that it "takes up a staggering 38.9mb of disk space." Ghost Graffiti

In the Vinewood Cemetery, there is graffiti that only appears between 8:00 pm to 6:00 am. It reads "Families 4 Life", another reads "Ballas" and a third reads "OGF". Hidden Sign

On top of the Gant Bridge, there is a sign that reads "There are no easter eggs up here. Go away." Mass Grave

Near Area 69, there is a hole that is filled with six body bags. Scott Wilson's Grave

In the Palomino Creek graveyard, there is a grave which reads "R.I.P Scott Wilson". Image Description Caligula's Palace Model

On the top floor of the Las Venturas City Planning Department, a model of Caligula's Palace can be found with a Rockstar logo on it. Clothing

Some of the clothing that the player wears, as well the suitcase at the start of the game that CJ holds while in the airport, and more items have the Rockstar Games logo on them. Parachute

The parachute has a small Rockstar North logo on the back. San Fierro Tower

If viewing the San Fierro Tower at night from the south, the player can see the Rockstar Games logo being shown as the lighting of the building. Stars

At night, if the player looks up in the sky there are stars that form the letter R in reference to the Rockstar Games logo, with a larger star representing the star from the logo. Zero RC

The kites and sail boat inside Zero RC have the Rockstar logo on them. Image Description Carcer Gas

Carcer Gas cylinders are from Carcer City, the setting of Manhunt. Doormat

Inside Big Smoke's Crack Palace, there is a doormat that reads "Not Welcome Rockstar North" with the Rockstar North logo in the center. Hydra

Part of the text on the side of the Hydra features the letters "DMA"; this is likely a reference to Rockstar North since the company was formerly known as DMA Design. DMA is also a play on United States Marine Corps squadrons that use the AV-8B Harrier II (VMA). Jesus Saves

The Jesus Saves graffiti in El Corona could be a reference to a save point in Grand Theft Auto 2. Manhunt Blueprint

In Las Venturas City Planning Department on the top floor, the blueprints of w:c:manhuntgame:Starkweather's Estate from Manhunt can be seen on the wall. Mugshots

Inside Las Venturas Police Headquarters, there are pictures of James Earl Cash and members of The Hoods from Rockstar North's Manhunt. Northstar Rock

Northstar Rock is a reference to Rockstar North. State of Emergency

The cheat code "Chaos Mode" could reference Rockstar and VIS Entertainment's 2001 game, State of Emergency. Chaos Mode was one of the playable game modes in this game. Window Pane

The Gasso gas station in Dillimore has a sign on its window reading "Max Pane- Bulletproof Glass". This is a reference to Rockstar's Max Payne franchise. Zero RC

Inside Zero RC, there are figures of not just Grand Theft Auto: Vice City characters, but also characters from Rockstar's 2003 game, Manhunt. The characters for it include James Earl Cash and Piggsy. Image Description Carl's surfboard

Carl's wardrobe contains a surfboard with an image of Vice City on it. Denise's poster

In Denise Robinson's house, there is a poster of Grand Theft Auto: Vice City's box art on her bedroom wall. Jethro & Dwaine

In the mission "Wear Flowers in Your Hair", The Truth says that his guys (Jethro and Dwaine) "used to work on marine engines, 'til the mob bought their business over in Vice." This may refer to Tommy Vercetti and his gang taking over the shipyard in the events of Grand Theft Auto: Vice City. Ryder's poster

In Ryder's house, there is a Grand Theft Auto: Vice City poster near the TV. Films inside the sex shop

Inside the enterable branch of Sex Shop XXX in Las Venturas, on the counter in the back, there are multiple stacks of films called "Grand Theft Auto: Vice City", clearly referencing the previous game in the series. V-Rock hotel

The V-Rock Hotel in Las Venturas is a reference to the V-Rock radio station in GTA Vice City. Vice City map

Across the street from the Angel Pine Cluckin' Bell, in several trash cans, there is a map of Vice City. Image Description Driver

During the mission "Madd Dogg's Rhymes", a guard remarks: "Man, how could Refractions mess up so bad? Tanner, you suck!" while he is playing a video game. This is a reference to Tanner, the protagonist of the Driver video game series, developed by Reflections. Half-Life

In the mission "Black Project", the player can spot a crowbar on a table in a lab. This is a reference to Valve's 1998 game Half-Life. Opposition Memorial

The Opposition Memorial in Hashbury, San Fierro, all of the tombstones read "RIP Opposition 1997-2004". This is a reference to rivals of the Grand Theft Auto series, which came out with its first game in 1997. The phrase "RIP Opposition" is referencing Rockstar's rivalry with other game companies, and how all of Rockstar's opposition has not been able to come out with a better video game. The opposition may also refer to the game Driver 3, which was a long-time rival of Rockstar and that came out in the same year and got negative votes from critics. Postal

In the mission "Black Project", after the player enters the base and the alarm is raised, one of the voice announcements says "Personnel reminded that running in corridors whilst holding scissors is not permitted". This is a possible reference to the video game company Running with Scissors, best known for its Postal games, which are considered by some to be "GTA Clones". Resident Evil

The Zombotech Corporation is most likely a reference to the Umbrella Corporation from the Resident Evil series. Also, based on a diagram on the wall, there appears to be a large underground facility reminiscent of the Hive from the Resident Evil Film. True Crime

There are multiple billboards around the state referencing a company named True Grime Street Cleaners. This is a reference to the True Crime series, another open world game of similar gameplay to the GTA series.
